â›½ Oil & Gasoline Market Update â€“ June 17, 2025 ğŸŒ

ğŸ›¢ï¸ Crude Oil (WTI) is trading around $78.60/barrel, with prices stabilizing after OPEC+ reaffirmed production cuts through Q3.

ğŸŒ Brent Crude holds at $82.20, reflecting geopolitical tension in the Middle East and reduced U.S. shale output.

ğŸš— Gasoline Prices in the U.S. average $3.46/gal, slightly down from last month. Demand is seasonally strong, but refinery maintenance has tightened supply.

ğŸ“ˆ Why it matters:

Summer driving season = higher fuel demand

Lower inventories = price pressure upward

Fed interest rate trajectory = affects demand outlook

ğŸ” What to watch:

U.S. inventory reports (API & EIA)

Hurricane season risks

Global demand signals from China & India

ğŸ’¬ Investor Insight: Energy stocks like XOM (ExxonMobil), CVX (Chevron), and SLB (Schlumberger) remain solid plays as oil stabilizes. Clean energy ETFs also see rotation as investors hedge volatility.
